intro: Dasylirion gracile, commonly known as the slender sotol, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically blue-gray in color. It produces tall, branched inflorescences bearing small, white to pale green flowers. Dasylirion gracile is adapted to withstand drought and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
